intro: Acrolophus diffusus, commonly known as the broadleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in dry environments. Its flowers are typically small and pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. Acrolophus diffusus is adapted to thrive in sandy soils and is often found in desert or coastal habitats.
